**Bilingual Request for Proposal (RFP) Title**

Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Program - Pinehouse Lake, Saskatchewan
Programme canadien de suivi et d’échantillonnage de l’air et des précipitations - Lac Pinehouse, Saskatchewan

**RFP Reference Number:** 5000056941RR
Numéro de référence: 5000056941RR

**Publication Date:** 2022-11-07
**Closing Date:** 2022-11-28T15:00:00
**Public Service Category:** SRV
**Procurement Method:** Competitive Open Bidding

**Background:**

Environment and Climate Change Canada is seeking a contractor to provide daily technical support (7 days a week, 52 weeks a year) at the Pinehouse Lake CAPMoN Monitoring Site (12 kilometers west of Pinehouse Lake, Saskatchewan). The contractor must attend to the site to retrieve and process precipitation and/or air samples in accordance with the CAPMoN Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). The collected samples will be shipped to the CAPMoN National Laboratory for analysis.

**Scope of Work:**

The contractor will be responsible for:

1. Servicing precipitation collectors, air filter sampling systems, ozone sampling systems, gaseous nitrogen and sulphur dioxide measurement systems, mercury in precipitation measurement systems, and AMoN Passive Sampler Measurements.
2. Packaging and shipping samples to the designated laboratory as outlined in the Site Operations Reference Manuals.
3. First-level maintenance, diagnosis of problems, and minor repairs to equipment.
4. Routine site maintenance, including clearing the sampling hut stairs and deck, grass cutting, and keeping the snow off the sampling hut.

**Additional Requirements:**

• The contractor must understand the need to protect sensitive and expensive research and monitoring equipment.
• The contractor may be required to perform unforeseen work and emergency repairs as needed.
• The contractor must adhere to the Site Operations Reference Manuals and any amendments.

**Submission Requirements:**

Proposals must be submitted in the minimum time required. A detailed RFP document with the requirements and evaluation criteria is available for download.
